transportAdvice: Cairns city centre is compact and walkable, with most tourist attractions, restaurants, and the Esplanade easily reached on foot. A local bus network connects the city to nearby beaches and suburbs, and taxis are readily available for longer journeys or transfers to the airport.

weather.description: Peak wet season with heavy tropical downpours, high humidity, and occasional cyclone risk — outdoor activities can be disrupted.
Wet season continues with frequent intense rainfall and very high humidity, though sunny spells still occur between storms.
Still firmly in the wet season with significant rainfall, though totals begin to ease slightly toward the end of the month.
Transitional month as the wet season winds down, with decreasing rain and gradually more comfortable conditions.
The dry season begins, bringing sunny days, lower humidity, and pleasant temperatures ideal for outdoor activities.
One of the coolest and driest months, with comfortable temperatures and low humidity — excellent conditions for reef and rainforest visits.
Peak dry season and the most popular tourist month, with clear skies, minimal rain, and the most comfortable temperatures of the year.
Continued dry and sunny weather with low humidity makes this another excellent month for snorkelling, diving, and hiking.
Warm and mostly dry with increasing sunshine, still very pleasant for all outdoor and water-based activities.
Temperatures rise noticeably and humidity begins to build as the wet season approaches, though rain remains infrequent.
The build-up season brings increasing heat, humidity, and afternoon thunderstorms as the wet season draws near.
Wet season arrives with heavy tropical rain, high humidity, and hot temperatures — stinger season also affects coastal swimming.
